Student.title: Student
Student.description: Represents a student in the MathQuest application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Student entity.

grade.description: The grade level of the student (1-5).

Teacher.title: Teacher
Teacher.description: Represents a teacher in the MathQuest application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Teacher entity.

Lesson.title: Lesson
Lesson.description: Represents a lesson available in the MathQuest application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Lesson entity.

grade.description: The grade level the lesson is designed for (1-5).

topic.description: The math topic covered in the lesson (e.g., addition, subtraction).

contentUrl.description: URL to the lesson content (video, interactive game, etc.).

Quiz.title: Quiz
Quiz.description: Represents a quiz available in the MathQuest application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Quiz entity.

grade.description: The grade level the quiz is designed for (1-5).

topic.description: The math topic covered in the quiz (e.g., addition, subtraction).

TutoringSession.title: TutoringSession
TutoringSession.description: Represents a tutoring session booked between a student and a teacher.

id.description: Unique identifier for the TutoringSession entity.

startTime.description: The date and time the tutoring session starts.

durationMinutes.description: The duration of the tutoring session in minutes.

topic.description: The topic covered in the tutoring session.

meetingLink.description: Link to the virtual meeting for the tutoring session.

StudentProgress.title: StudentProgress
StudentProgress.description: Represents a student's progress in a lesson or quiz.

id.description: Unique identifier for the StudentProgress entity.

lessonId.description: Reference to Lesson. (Relationship: Lesson 1:N StudentProgress, nullable)

quizId.description: Reference to Quiz. (Relationship: Quiz 1:N StudentProgress, nullable)

completed.description: Indicates whether the student has completed the lesson or quiz.

score.description: The student's score on the quiz (if applicable).

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to ensure Authorization Independence, DBAC, and support secure list operations (QAPs). It leverages structural segregation and denormalization strategies.  The top-level collections segregate data types with different security postures. User-owned data resides within `/users/{userId}` subcollections, providing clear ownership. Collaborative data, such as tutoring sessions, are managed in collections with explicit membership maps. The `roles_teacher` collection implements DBAC.

**Authorization Independence**: Achieved by storing all authorization-relevant data directly within each document, avoiding `get()` calls in security rules.  For example, the `TutoringSessions` collection includes both `studentId` and `teacherId`, removing the need to fetch user roles during authorization checks. The `StudentProgress` collection is located under `/users/{studentId}`, enabling QAPs.

**QAPs (Rules are not Filters)**: Each collection has a clear security posture, allowing for efficient and secure list operations. Placing `StudentProgress` under the user's document `/users/{userId}/progress/{progressId}` ensures only the student or an admin can access their progress data.
